meanings.def: a character in Oscar Wilde's play The Importance of Being Earnest. She is a severe upper-class Englishwoman who speaks some of Wilde's most humorous lines. Jack, the main character, is in love with her daughter.“To lose one parent, Mr Worthing, may be regarded as a misfortune; to lose both looks like carelessness.”Lady Bracknell

(11th century) the wife of an earl of Mercia. According to legend, she asked her husband to lower the taxes on the people of Coventry and he said that he would do so if she rode her horse naked through the town. She did this, and the taxes were lowered.
a word used to mean ‘woman’ that some people, especially older people, consider is more polite
examples: There's a lady waiting to see you.
an old/elderly lady
He was with an attractive young lady.
And who is this lovely lady?
the lady with the red hair
the lady in the designer dress
the ladies’ golf championship
(British English, old-fashioned) a tea lady (= a woman who serves tea in an office)
(North American English, approving) She's a tough lady.
a lady doctor/golfer

meanings.def: a woman who is polite and well educated, has excellent manners and always behaves well
examples: His wife was a real lady.
You could at least try to behave like a lady.

meanings.def: used when speaking to or about a girl or woman, especially somebody you do not know
examples: Can I take your coats, ladies?
Could I have your attention, ladies and gentlemen?

meanings.def: an informal way to talk to a woman, showing a lack of respect
examples: Listen, lady, don't shout at me.

meanings.def: (in the UK) a woman belonging to a high social class
examples: the lords and ladies of the court
a lady’s maid

meanings.def: (in the UK) a title used by a woman who is a member of the nobility, or by somebody who has been given the title ‘lady’ as an honour. The wives and daughters of some members of the nobility and the wives of knights are also called ‘Lady’.
examples: Lady Howe
Lady Jane Grey

meanings.def: a toilet for women in a public building or place
examples: Could you tell me where the ladies is?

meanings.def: a title used to refer to Mary, the mother of Christ, especially in the Roman Catholic Church
examples: Our Lady of Lourdes

meanings.def: a man/woman who does not have to work
used for saying that a situation may still change, for example that a contest, election, etc. is not finished yet, and somebody still has a chance to win it

idioms.def: a man/woman who does not have to work

idioms.idiom: it’s not over until the fat lady sings
idioms.def: used for saying that a situation may still change, for example that a contest, election, etc. is not finished yet, and somebody still has a chance to win it
